DOC.brief_title: Reducing Hemodialysis Catheter Use Prevalent Hemodialysis Patients
DOC.detailed_description: In order receive dialysis , patient require repeated access bloodstream . This access either via central venous catheter ( CVC ) surgically create arteriovenous fistula ( AVF ) graft ( AVG ) . This pilot randomize control trial prevalent hemodialysis patient central venous catheter ( CVC ) , determine systematic approach use algorithm protocol convert CVC AVF ( arteriovenous fistula ) improve rate function AVF decrease CVC use . The algorithm ( intervention group ) compare current practice ( control group ) , non-standardized approach discretion care nephrologist and/or surgeon .
DOC.criteria: > 18 year age Dialyzing CVC Receiving hemodialysis three time weekly > 3 month Awaiting peritoneal dialysis catheter insertion Scheduled live donor transplant Transient patient province Expected transfer satellite dialysis unit within 6 month Surgical plan AVF ( i.e . schedule date ) Documented lack suitable vasculature AVF Refusing AVF
